title: Adele is teaching son Angelo to be a gentleman | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 512 shares However in the intimate interview, the British songstress spoke of the values she is hoping to instill in Angelo, born in October 2012, in order for him to grow into a gentleman. She said: 'I'm raising him to respect women. He knows I'm a powerful force.' Strong: The singer, 28, revealed that despite her boy's tender age, she is already raising him to be courteous to women - and to respect 'powerful' female forces such as herself (above) Doing it right: She said of her attitude to motherhood: 'I'm raising him to respect women. He knows I'm a powerful force' 'He feels it at home, let alone when he comes to work with me. And he comes everywhere with me anyway!' Confirming that the pair are joined at the hip, Adele was seen touching down in Sydney, Australia on Sunday for the next leg of her tour - with her sweet boy wrapped around her shoulders. The singer shares her son with husband Simon, the founder of the charity Drop4Drop, who she met back in 2011. Spilling all: The Rolling In The Deep singer is usually tight-lipped about her private life with husband Simon Konecki (above) - who she only recently revealed she had married Reinforcing her notorious privacy, Adele only announced the pair had married in secret by referring to Simon as her 'husband' while collecting her Album of the Year Grammy award. Taking to the stage at the Staples Center in Los Angeles the Rumour Has It hitmaker gushed: 'Grammys, I appreciate it, the Academy, I love you, my manager, my husband and my son – you’re the only reason I do it.' It was an incredibly successful awards show for the star, after she scored five Grammys - including Best Album, Best Song and Record Of The Year at the February 12 ceremony in Los Angeles. Woman of the hour: It was an incredibly successful awards show for the star, after she scored five Grammys - including Best Album, Best Song and Record Of The Year Inspired: She later caused waves among fans and the crowd when she broke her Album of the Year Grammy in half, explaining she felt Beyonce's Lemonade should have won over hers She later caused waves among fans and the crowd when she broke her Album of the Year Grammy in half, explaining she felt Beyonce's Lemonade should have won over her album 25. Talking of the influence the Crazy In Love singer has had on her career, she gushed as the so-called Queen Bey teared up: 'I can’t possibly accept this award, the artist of my life is Beyonce.' Read more: The full interview is in this week's OK! Magazine, out now 'The Lemonade album is just so monumental Beyonce so monumental and so well thought out and so beautiful and soul bearing. 'All us artists adore you, you are our light.' Speaking about the speech to OK!, Adele confirmed her gratitude for the award - but continued that she felt she had to thank Beyoncé, as the inspiration for her to make music in the first place. 'I am of course very grateful to have won it,' she explained. 'But I felt the need to say that because I love her and I felt like she was more worthy.' The night only added to her success in recent times, with it being reported that she made over £500,000 every night during her Adele Live world tour last year. The singer has become one of the highest-paid performers ever after raking in the huge amount, according to new accounts filed by her firm Remedy Touring, of which she is the sole director.
